intro: Phelipanche portoilicitana, commonly known as the Portuguese morning glory, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in the morning. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its invasive potential, it is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
